article.headline: Northeastern 84, Hofstra 74
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Bennet Davis scored 27 points and added 11 rebounds to lead Northeastern to an 84-74 win over Hofstra on Saturday. The Huskies (5-12, 3-3 Colonial Athletic Association) took control of the game with a 13-0 first-half run that opened up a 25-12 lead. Hofstra (12-5, 5-1 CAA) would never get closer than seven points the rest of the way. The win gave Northeastern back-to-back victories for the first time all season while snapping Hofstra's six-game winning streak. The Huskies didn't commit any turnovers in the first half and took a 37-27 lead at halftime. Northeastern enjoyed a huge advantage at the foul line throughout the game, making 25 of 30 shots. Hofstra made 8 of 10 free throws. Four players reached double figures for Northeastern. Besides Davis' 27, Adrian Martinez scored 19, Bobby Kelly had 15 and Matt Janning had 10. Hofstra's Loren Stokes continued his success against the Huskies with a season-high 30 points. Last year, he had a career-high 32 against Northeastern. Antoine Agudio added 25 points for Hofstra. No other Hofstra player had more than eight points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
